versionHistory.author: Marsel Nakuci
versionHistory.changes: Add property for the fixtures, screwa

versionHistory.author: Marsel Nakuci
versionHistory.changes: Initialize properties from xml only if they are not set in the properties

usageEnvironment.detectionEvidence: The script creates 3D geometry (Body 'bdPart') and hardware components (HardWrComp) attached to GenBeams. It references 'bm0' and 'bm1' and distinguishes between 'main beam' and 'secondary beam'. There is no usage of 'sd_' prefixes, Viewport handling, or 2D layout generation typical of Paper Space scripts.

opmProperties.description: Defines the Distance in Height direction
Defines the Distance in Width direction
Specifies the fixture for the connector at secondary beam.
Specifies the fixture for the connector at main beam.

contextMenu.action: Toggles the visibility of the component label (Tag).
Default double-click behavior (likely opening properties or edit dialog).

settingsFiles.purpose: Contains default parameters, manufacturer data, families, models, and dimensions.

data.raw_content:
```json
{
  "scriptPurpose": {
    "summary": "Generates hidden timber connectors (specifically Ricon/KNAPP types) between a main and secondary beam, handling both the 3D solid representation and the necessary timber milling/drilling operations.",
    "category": "Hardware / Connection",
    "typicalUseCase": "Used in timber frame construction to connect beams (e.g., purlins to rafters, or studs to plates) using concealed metal plates that require precise pockets and drill holes."
  },
  "parameters": [
    {
      "name": "sManufacturer",
      "technicalDefault": "",
      "businessMeaning": "Selects the hardware manufacturer (e.g., Knapp) from the external database.",
      "validRange": "List loaded from XML (e.g., 'Knapp')",
      "unit": "String",
      "affectsOutput": "Filters the available Families and Models; loads manufacturer-specific catalog defaults."
    },
    {
      "name": "sFamily",
      "technicalDefault": "",
      "businessMeaning": "Selects the product family (e.g., Hidden Connector series).",
      "validRange": "List dependent on Manufacturer",
      "unit": "String",
      "affectsOutput": "Filters the available Models; defines the general category of the hardware geometry."
    },
    {
      "name": "sModel",
      "technicalDefault": "",
      "businessMeaning": "Selects the specific part number/model (e.g., 'Ricon S SK...').",
      "validRange": "List dependent on Family",
      "unit": "String",
      "affectsOutput": "Sets the default dimensions (Width, Height, Depth), screw positions, and BOM article number."
    },
    {
      "name": "sMilling",
      "technicalDefault": "Male",
      "businessMeaning": "Defines the gender of the connection for the current insertion. 'Male' typically creates the positive protrusion on the secondary beam and the pocket on the main beam.",
      "validRange": "Male, Female",
      "unit": "Enum",
      "affectsOutput": "Swaps the geometric generation between the main beam (pocket) and secondary beam (solid/protrusion). Changes which screw holes are generated on which beam."
    },
    {
      "name": "dMillingWidthFemale",
      "technicalDefault": "0.0",
      "businessMeaning": "The width of the pocket (mortise) cut into the female beam.",
      "validRange": "Hardware specific (e.g., 60mm - 200mm)",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Geometry of the cut on the Female beam."
    },
    {
      "name": "dMillingHeightFemale",
      "technicalDefault": "0.0",
      "businessMeaning": "The height of the pocket (mortise) cut into the female beam.",
      "validRange": "Hardware specific",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Geometry of the cut on the Female beam."
    },
    {
      "name": "dMillingDepthFemale",
      "technicalDefault": "0.0",
      "businessMeaning": "The depth of the pocket (mortise) cut into the female beam.",
      "validRange": "Hardware specific",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Geometry of the cut on the Female beam."
    },
    {
      "name": "dMillingWidthMale",
      "technicalDefault": "0.0",
      "businessMeaning": "The width of the connector body/milling on the male beam.",
      "validRange": "Hardware specific",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Geometry of the cut/part on the Male beam."
    },
    {
      "name": "dMillingHeightMale",
      "technicalDefault": "0.0",
      "businessMeaning": "The height of the connector body/milling on the male beam.",
      "validRange": "Hardware specific",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Geometry of the cut/part on the Male beam."
    },
    {
      "name": "dMillingDepthMale",
      "technicalDefault": "0.0",
      "businessMeaning": "The depth of the connector body/milling on the male beam.",
      "validRange": "Hardware specific",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Geometry of the cut/part on the Male beam."
    },
    {
      "name": "dDistanceHeight",
      "technicalDefault": "0.0",
      "businessMeaning": "Vertical offset of the connector from a reference point (usually the top surface or centerline of the beam).",
      "validRange": "0.0 to Beam Height",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Moves the connector and pocket up or down within the beam cross-section."
    },
    {
      "name": "dDistanceWidth",
      "technicalDefault": "0.0",
      "businessMeaning": "Lateral offset of the connector from a reference point (usually the side face or centerline of the beam).",
      "validRange": "0.0 to Beam Width",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Moves the connector and pocket left or right within the beam cross-section."
    },
    {
      "name": "sFixture",
      "technicalDefault": "None",
      "businessMeaning": "Specifies the screw type used to fasten the connector to the secondary beam (Nebenträger).",
      "validRange": "None, Ricon S SK-Schraube 8x80, etc.",
      "unit": "String",
      "affectsOutput": "Generates drill holes in the secondary beam and adds the screw to the BOM (HardWrComp)."
    },
    {
      "name": "sFixture1",
      "technicalDefault": "None",
      "businessMeaning": "Specifies the screw type used to fasten the connector to the main beam (Hauptträger).",
      "validRange": "None, Ricon S SK-Schraube 8x80, etc.",
      "unit": "String",
      "affectsOutput": "Generates drill holes in the main beam and adds the screw to the BOM (HardWrComp)."
    },
    {
      "name": "nColor",
      "technicalDefault": "7",
      "businessMeaning": "CAD display color for the 3D representation.",
      "validRange": "AutoCAD Color Index (0-255)",
      "unit": "Index",
      "affectsOutput": "Visual appearance in Model Space only."
    },
    {
      "name": "bShowTag",
      "technicalDefault": "0",
      "businessMeaning": "Toggles the visibility of the assembly label/text in the 3D model (specific for Baufritz projects).",
      "validRange": "0 (No), 1 (Yes)",
      "unit": "Boolean",
      "affectsOutput": "Shows or hides text identifying the Model and Screw count."
    }
  ],
  "parameterDependencies": [
    {
      "trigger": "Changing sManufacturer",
      "effect": "Resets sFamily and sModel to empty or first valid option.",
      "cascade": [
        "sFamily",
        "sModel"
      ]
    },
    {
      "trigger": "Changing sModel",
      "effect": "Updates Milling dimensions (Width, Height, Depth), Distances, and default Fixtures based on XML data.",
      "cascade": [
        "dMillingWidthFemale",
        "dMillingHeightFemale",
        "dMillingDepthFemale",
        "dMillingWidthMale",
        "dMillingHeightMale",
        "dMillingDepthMale",
        "dDistanceHeight",
        "dDistanceWidth",
        "sFixture",
        "sFixture1"
      ]
    },
    {
      "trigger": "Project

workflowDiagram: Launch script: Command or hsbCAD Menu
Load Settings: Search and parse 'hsbHiddenConnector.xml' from Company or Install directory
Validate Settings: Check if Manufacturer data exists in XML
Insert Mode (_bOnInsert): Prompt user to select Main Beam (GenBeam)
Insert Mode: Prompt user to select Secondary Beam (GenBeam)
Insert Mode: Prompt user to select connection point on Main Beam
Validate Selections: Ensure selected entities are valid GenBeams
Initialize Properties: Populate dropdown lists for Manufacturer, Family, and Model based on XML
Configure User Input: User selects Model and Milling Side (Male/Female) via Properties Palette (OPM)
Load Parameters: Script retrieves dimensions and fixtures from XML based on selected Model
Determine Logic Branch: Check 'Milling Side' and Project Type (Baufritz vs Standard)
Generate Geometry: Create solid body (Male or Female part) and apply coordinate transformations
Process Fixtures: Determine screws/nails (from XML or user property) and create Hardware Components
Generate Visualization: Draw 3D representation and optional Tags (if Baufritz)
Finalize: Update BOM (HardWrComps) and display solid

path1.name: Female Mode
steps: Generate geometry based on 'Female' XML dimensions
Process fixtures: Use XML Nail/Screw lists or 'sFixture' property (if Baufritz)

path2.name: Male Mode
steps: Generate geometry based on 'Male' XML dimensions
Process fixtures: Use XML Nail/Screw lists or 'sFixture1' property (if Baufritz)

path1.name: Baufritz Project
steps: Enable 'Verbindungsmittel' properties in OPM for user selection
Generate component labels/tags in 3D view based on 'Show Tag' property
Use specific screw logic for BOM (HardWrComp)

path2.name: Standard Project
steps: Read fixture data exclusively from XML file

validationRules.errorMessage: Could not find manufacturer data. Tool will be deleted.
validationRules.recovery: Ensure 'hsbHiddenConnector.xml' is present in the correct folder and contains valid 'Manufacturer' entries.
Script automatically erases itself if the selected entities (bm0 or bm1) are not valid GenBeams. User must re-insert and select correct beams.

validationRules.errorMessage: Notice: A different Version of the settings has been found for [ScriptName]. Current Version [X] Other Version [Y]
validationRules.recovery: Update XML settings file or Company folder to match the expected version. Script continues to load.

postInsertionActions.effect: Updates dimensions, depths, and default fixtures to match the new selection from the XML catalog.
Swaps the geometric generation between the Main Beam (Female) and Secondary Beam (Male).

postInsertionActions.how: Right-click Context Menu -> 'Show Tag' (or Properties Palette -> Display -> Show Tag)
postInsertionActions.effect: Toggles the 3D text label identifying the Model and Screw count (Specific to Baufritz projects).
Manually overrides the standard Width, Height, or Depth of the milling/connection.

data.markdown:
# hsbHiddenConnector.mcr ## Overview This script generates hidden timber connectors (such as Ricon or KNAPP types) between a main beam and a secondary beam. It automatically creates the necessary 3D geometry (pockets or protrusions), drill holes, and hardware components based on a configurable XML catalog. ## Usage Environment | Space | Supported | Notes | |-------|-----------|-------| | Model Space | Yes | Script operates in 3D to create solids and modify beams. | | Paper Space | No | Not designed for 2D layout or view generation. | | Shop Drawing | No | Generates physical geometry, not annotations. | ## Prerequisites - **Required Entities**: Two GenBeams (Main and Secondary). - **Minimum Beam Count**: 2 - **Required Settings Files**: `hsbHiddenConnector.xml` (Must be located in the Company or Install `TSL\Settings` folder). ## Usage Steps ### Step 1: Launch Script Command: `TSLINSERT` → Select `hsbHiddenConnector.mcr` from the list. ### Step 2: Select Main Beam ``` Command Line: Select Main Beam Action: Click on the primary beam (e.g., a rafter or top plate) that will hold the connector pocket. ``` ### Step 3: Select Secondary Beam ``` Command Line: Select Secondary Beam Action: Click on the intersecting beam (e.g., a purlin or stud) that will hold the connector part. ``` ### Step 4: Select Insertion Point ``` Command Line: Select point on main beam Action: Click on the main beam to define the precise location for the hidden connector. ``` ### Step 5: Configure Connector 1. Select the inserted script instance. 2. Open the **Properties Palette** (Ctrl+1). 3. Under the **Component** category, select the **Manufacturer**, **Family**, and **Model**. 4. Adjust the **Milling** direction (Male/Female) if necessary. ## Properties Panel Parameters | Parameter | Type | Default | Description | |-----------|------|---------|-------------| | **Manufacturer** | Dropdown | | Select the hardware manufacturer (e.g., Knapp). This filters the available families. | | **Family** | Dropdown | | Select the product family (e.g., Hidden Connector). This filters the available models. | | **Model** | Dropdown | | Select the specific connector model (e.g., Ricon S SK-Schraube). Selecting this automatically loads dimensions and screw settings. | | **Milling** | Dropdown | Male | Determines which side the connector is generated on.
• **Male**: Solid part on Secondary Beam.
• **Female**: Pocket on Main Beam. | | **Width (Female/Male)** | Number | 0.0 | Defines the width of the milling or connector body. | | **Height (Female/Male)** | Number | 0.0 | Defines the height of the milling or connector body. | | **Depth (Female/Male)** | Number | 0.0 | Defines the depth of the pocket or length of the connector. | | **Distance Height** | Number | 0.0 | Vertical offset of the connector from the beam reference point. | | **Distance Width** | Number | 0.0 | Lateral offset of the connector from the beam reference point. | | **Verbindungsmittel Nebenträger** | Dropdown | None | Selects the screw type for the Secondary Beam. (Visible depending on project configuration). | | **Verbindungsmittel Hauptträger** | Dropdown | None | Selects the screw type for the Main Beam. (Visible depending on project configuration). | | **Color** | Number | 7 | Sets the display color of the 3D connector representation. | | **Show Tag** | Dropdown | No | Toggles the visibility of the text label identifying the connector model in the 3D model. | ## Right-Click Menu Options | Menu Item | Description | |-----------|-------------| | **Show Tag** | Toggles the visibility of the connector label (Tag) in the 3D model. Useful for identification in assembly views. | | **TslDoubleClick** | Default action; typically re-opens the Properties Palette or highlights the script for editing. | ## Settings Files - **Filename**: `hsbHiddenConnector.xml` - **Location**: `_kPathHsbCompany\TSL\Settings` or `_kPathHsbInstall\Content\General\TSL\Settings` - **Purpose**: Contains the catalog of manufacturers, families, models, and their specific dimensions (Width, Height, Depth) and default screw configurations. ## Tips - **Cascading Selections**: Always select the **Manufacturer** first. The **Family** and **Model** dropdowns will update automatically based on your previous selection. - **Swapping Sides**: Use the **Milling** property to switch between creating a pocket on the main beam (Female) or a solid connector on the secondary beam (Male). - **Dimensions**: If you select a Model, the width, height, and depth are filled automatically. You can manually override these values if you need a custom fit. - **Tags**: The "Show Tag" feature is particularly useful for Baufritz projects to identify connectors directly in the 3D model without opening properties. ## FAQ - **Q: Why did the script disappear after I selected the beams?** A: This usually happens if the script cannot find the `hsbHiddenConnector.xml` file or if the selected beams were invalid (not GenBeams). Ensure the XML file is in the correct Settings folder and that you select valid timber beams. - **Q: How do I change the screw type used?** A: In the Properties Palette, look for the "Verbindungsmittel" (Connectors/Fasteners) category. You can select different screw options for both the Main and Secondary beams. - **Q: Can I offset the connector from the center?** A: Yes. Use the "Distance Height" and "Distance Width" properties in the Position category to move the connector within the beam cross-section.
